    • Constructor Detail

      • Invader_GUI

        public Invader_GUI(int rows,
                   int duckHealth,
                   int duckVelocity,
                   int numberOfBullets,
                   boolean firstTime)
        sets up the GUI and starts the timer. Creates player and enemy manager as well.
        Parameters:
        rows - number of rows of ducks
        duckHealth - how much health each duck has
        duckVelocity - how quick each duck moves
        numberOfBullets - number of player bullets that can be on screen at one time
        firstTime - if the game is first time this should be positive

    • Method Detail

        public static void play(java.lang.String fileName)

      • close

        public void close()

      • run

        public void run()
        called every tick of the timer. moves enemies, bullets, and checks for collisions.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Specified by:
        run in class java.util.TimerTask

      • checkForCollision

        public void checkForCollision()
        checks for collision by creating a 2d array of ints that represents all the living ducks' locations. Do the same with players.
        See Also:
        playerBullets, ducks

      • keyPressed

        public void keyPressed(java.awt.event.KeyEvent key)
        if the key was space, will shoot and then set spacePressed to true, which indicates that space is pressed. If the key was not space, will register that arrow was pressed and set arrowPressed to true
        Specified by:
        keyPressed in interface java.awt.event.KeyListener

      • keyReleased

        public void keyReleased(java.awt.event.KeyEvent key)
        if the key that was release was space, set spacePressed to false. Likewise with arrow and arrowPressed
        Specified by:
        keyReleased in interface java.awt.event.KeyListener

      • keyTyped

        public void keyTyped(java.awt.event.KeyEvent key)
        Specified by:
        keyTyped in interface java.awt.event.KeyListener
